canonical_explanation.text: All matter is made up of tiny particles. An atom is the smallest particle of an element that retains its chemical properties. Atoms are too small to be seen even with the most powerful microscopes. A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently. Molecules are formed when atoms combine together. Molecules can be of elements (made of same type of atoms) or compounds (made of different types of atoms). Based on the number of atoms in a molecule, elements can be monoatomic (one atom), diatomic (two atoms), or polyatomic (more than two atoms).
rules: Atom is the smallest particle of an element
Molecule is the smallest particle of a substance with independent existence
Monoatomic molecules: contain one atom (He, Ne, Ar)
Diatomic molecules: contain two atoms (H2, O2, N2, Cl2)
Polyatomic molecules: contain more than two atoms (P4, S8, O3)
Molecules of compounds contain different types of atoms
Examples of compound molecules: H2O, CO2, NH3
Atomicity is the number of atoms in a molecule

questions.question_text: What is an atom?

options.text: The smallest particle of a compound
The smallest particle of an element

questions.explanation_correct: An atom is the smallest particle of an element that retains its chemical properties. This means an atom is the basic building block of an element, and it has all the characteristics of that element.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An atom is not the smallest particle of a compound. A compound is made up of different types of atoms bonded together. The smallest particle of a compound would be a molecule, which contains two or more atoms. Atoms are the fundamental building blocks of all matter, and they are the smallest particles that still have the properties of an element.

questions.question_text: Atoms are:

options.text: Too small to be seen even with microscopes

questions.explanation_correct: Atoms are too small to be seen even with the most powerful microscopes. They are the smallest particles of an element that retain its chemical properties.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Atoms are not visible to the naked eye or very large particles. They are much smaller than what we can see. Molecules are the smallest particles of a substance that can exist independently, not atoms.

questions.question_text: All atoms of a particular element are:
questions.explanation_correct: All atoms of a particular element are identical to each other because they have the same number of protons in their nucleus. This makes all atoms of the same element have the same chemical properties.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because: A) Atoms of the same element are not different from each other, they are identical. C) Atoms are not made of molecules, they are the smallest particles of an element. D) Atoms are too small to be seen even with the most powerful microscopes.

questions.question_text: What is a molecule?

options.text: The smallest particle that can exist independently

questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) The smallest particle that can exist independently. A molecule is the smallest unit of a substance that can exist on its own. It is made up of two or more atoms bonded together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A) A single atom is incorrect because an atom is the smallest particle of an element, but it cannot exist independently. Option C) A group of elements is incorrect because a molecule is made up of atoms, not a group of elements. Option D) The largest particle of matter is incorrect because a molecule is one of the smallest units of matter, not the largest.

questions.question_text: Molecules are formed when:
questions.explanation_correct: Molecules are formed when atoms combine together. This is because atoms can join to form more complex structures called molecules, which can have different properties compared to the individual atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Molecules are not formed when atoms break apart or when matter is destroyed. Molecules are also not formed when elements evaporate. Molecules are formed when atoms come together and bond with each other, creating a new substance with its own unique properties.

questions.question_text: A molecule of an element is made up of:
questions.explanation_correct: A molecule of an element is made up of the same type of atoms because elements are made of only one type of atom. Molecules of elements are formed when atoms of that element bond together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A molecule of a compound is made up of different types of atoms, not the same type. This is because a compound is formed when atoms of different elements combine. A molecule of an element, on the other hand, is made up of the same type of atoms since elements are made of only one type of atom.

questions.question_text: A molecule of a compound is made up of:
questions.explanation_correct: A molecule of a compound is made up of different types of atoms. This is because a compound is formed when atoms of different elements combine together to create a new substance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that a molecule of a compound is made up of different types of atoms. Molecules of elements are made up of the same type of atoms, while compounds have molecules made up of atoms of different elements. A molecule cannot be made up of only one atom, as that would not be a complete molecule. Molecules are not made up of no atoms at all.

questions.question_text: Monoatomic molecules contain:
questions.explanation_correct: Monoatomic molecules contain only one atom, so the correct answer is B) One atom. This is because a monoatomic molecule is the smallest possible molecule, made up of a single atom of an element.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because a monoatomic molecule is made up of a single atom, not two atoms (option A), three atoms (option C), or many atoms (option D). Molecules can be monoatomic, diatomic (two atoms), or polyatomic (more than two atoms), but monoatomic molecules specifically contain only one atom.

questions.question_text: Diatomic molecules contain:
questions.explanation_correct: Diatomic molecules contain two atoms because the term 'diatomic' refers to molecules that are made up of two atoms. This means that diatomic molecules have exactly two atoms in their structure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diatomic molecules do not contain one, three, or four atoms. The term 'diatomic' specifically means that the molecule has two atoms. This is because the prefix 'di-' means 'two', so a diatomic molecule is a molecule with two atoms.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a diatomic molecule?
questions.explanation_correct: Hydrogen (H2) is a diatomic molecule because it is made up of two hydrogen atoms bonded together. A diatomic molecule has two atoms in its structure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Helium (He) is a monoatomic molecule, meaning it has only one atom. Ozone (O3) is a polyatomic molecule with three oxygen atoms. Phosphorus (P4) is also a polyatomic molecule with four phosphorus atoms. Therefore, the correct answer is Hydrogen (H2) because it is the only diatomic molecule among the given options.

questions.question_text: The atomicity of oxygen molecule (O2) is:
questions.explanation_correct: The atomicity of oxygen molecule (O2) is 2 because an oxygen molecule is made up of two oxygen atoms bonded together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atomicity of oxygen molecule (O2) is not 1, 3, or 4. An oxygen molecule is made up of two oxygen atoms, so its atomicity is 2. This means the molecule has two atoms joined together.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a monoatomic element?
questions.explanation_correct: Helium (He) is a monoatomic element, which means its atoms exist independently and do not combine with other atoms to form molecules. Helium has only one atom per particle, unlike oxygen (O2) or nitrogen (N2) which have two atoms per molecule.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oxygen (O), nitrogen (N), and chlorine (Cl) are all diatomic elements, which means their atoms exist in pairs to form molecules with two atoms. Only helium (He) is a monoatomic element, where each atom exists independently without forming a molecule.

questions.question_text: What is the atomicity of phosphorus (P4)?
questions.explanation_correct: The atomicity of phosphorus is 4 because a phosphorus molecule, represented as P4, is made up of 4 phosphorus atoms bonded together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atomicity of an element refers to the number of atoms present in a molecule of that element. Phosphorus has an atomicity of 4, which means that its molecule (P4) contains 4 phosphorus atoms bonded together. Options A, B, and C do not correctly represent the atomicity of phosphorus.

questions.question_text: Water molecule (H2O) contains:

options.text: 2 atoms of hydrogen and 1 atom of oxygen
1 atom of hydrogen and 2 atoms of oxygen
2 atoms of hydrogen and 2 atoms of oxygen
1 atom of hydrogen and 1 atom of oxygen

questions.explanation_correct: The water molecule (H2O) contains 2 atoms of hydrogen and 1 atom of oxygen, so the correct answer is option A.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water molecule is made up of 2 hydrogen atoms and 1 oxygen atom, not 1 hydrogen atom and 2 oxygen atoms (option B), 2 hydrogen atoms and 2 oxygen atoms (option C), or 1 hydrogen atom and 1 oxygen atom (option D). So the correct answer is option A, which shows the right number of each type of atom in the water molecule.

questions.question_text: Carbon dioxide molecule (CO2) contains:
questions.explanation_correct: The carbon dioxide (CO2) molecule contains 1 carbon atom and 2 oxygen atoms, so the correct answer is option B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The carbon dioxide (CO2) molecule is made up of 1 carbon atom and 2 oxygen atoms. Option A is incorrect because it has only 1 oxygen atom, option C has 2 carbon atoms, and option D has 2 carbon atoms and 2 oxygen atoms, which is not the correct structure of the CO2 molecule.

questions.question_text: Which element exists as polyatomic molecules?
questions.explanation_correct: Sulfur (S8) exists as polyatomic molecules, meaning that each sulfur molecule is made up of 8 sulfur atoms bonded together. This is because sulfur is a solid at room temperature and needs multiple atoms to form a stable molecule.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hydrogen and helium exist as monoatomic molecules, meaning each molecule has only one atom. Oxygen, on the other hand, exists as diatomic molecules, meaning each molecule has two oxygen atoms. Sulfur is the only element mentioned here that exists as polyatomic molecules, with 8 sulfur atoms bonded together in each molecule.

questions.question_text: The difference between an atom and a molecule is:

options.text: Molecules can exist independently while some atoms cannot
Atoms have color while molecules do not

questions.explanation_correct: The difference between an atom and a molecule is that molecules can exist independently, while some atoms cannot. Atoms are the smallest particles of an element, but they cannot exist alone and need to combine with other atoms to form molecules.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Molecules can exist independently, which means they can exist on their own, while some atoms cannot. Atoms are the smallest particles of an element, and they need to combine with other atoms to form molecules. Molecules can be made of the same type of atoms (elements) or different types of atoms (compounds), but they can exist on their own, unlike some atoms.

questions.question_text: Ozone (O3) is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Ozone (O3) is a triatomic molecule because it is made up of three oxygen atoms. This makes it an example of a polyatomic molecule, which is a molecule with more than two atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ozone (O3) is not a monoatomic molecule because monoatomic molecules are made up of only one atom. It is also not a diatomic molecule, which has two atoms. Ozone is a triatomic molecule because it has three oxygen atoms bonded together. The correct answer is option C.

questions.question_text: Which of the following represents a molecule of a compound?
questions.explanation_correct: The molecule NH3 (ammonia) is a compound because it is made of different types of atoms - nitrogen (N) and hydrogen (H). This represents a molecule of a compound, which is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The options A (O2) and D (Cl2) represent molecules of elements, made of the same type of atoms. Option B (N2) is also a molecule of an element. Only option C (NH3) represents a molecule of a compound, which is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which of the following represents a molecule of an element?
questions.explanation_correct: Option C, H2, represents a molecule of the element hydrogen. This is because a molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently, and hydrogen is a single element with only one type of atom, so a molecule of hydrogen would have two hydrogen atoms (H2).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options do not represent molecules of elements. Option A, H2O, is a molecule of the compound water, which is made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. Option B, CO2, is a molecule of the compound carbon dioxide, which is made of one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms. Option D, NaCl, is a compound of the elements sodium and chlorine, not a single element.

questions.question_text: The atomicity of argon (Ar) is:
questions.explanation_correct: The atomicity of argon (Ar) is 1 because an argon atom is made up of a single atom. Argon is a monoatomic element, meaning its atoms exist independently and do not form molecules.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atomicity of argon (Ar) is not 2, 3 or 4 because argon is a monoatomic element. This means its atoms exist independently and do not form molecules with other argon atoms. Argon has only one atom per particle, so its atomicity is 1.

questions.question_text: Which of the following gases is diatomic?
questions.explanation_correct: Nitrogen is a diatomic gas, meaning that its molecules are made up of two nitrogen atoms bonded together. This is because nitrogen is an element, and the simplest way for nitrogen atoms to form a stable molecule is by pairing up in twos.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Helium, neon, and argon are all monoatomic gases, which means their molecules are made up of only one atom each. These elements do not need to form bonds with other atoms to be stable, so they exist as single atoms rather than molecules.

questions.question_text: Why is an atom considered the smallest particle of an element?

options.text: Because it retains all properties of the element
Because it is made of molecules

questions.explanation_correct: An atom is considered the smallest particle of an element because it retains all the chemical properties of that element. Even though atoms are very small, they still have the unique characteristics that define the element.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is correct because atoms are the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Even though atoms are too small to be seen, they are the smallest particles that have the same chemical properties as the element they belong to. Options A, C, and D are incorrect because atoms are not invisible, they are not made of molecules, and their small size does not mean they are heavy.

questions.question_text: How many atoms are present in one molecule of ammonia (NH3)?
questions.explanation_correct: The molecule of ammonia (NH3) has 3 atoms - 1 nitrogen atom and 3 hydrogen atoms, so the correct answer is C) 4 atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ammonia (NH3) is made up of 1 nitrogen atom and 3 hydrogen atoms, which is a total of 4 atoms. So the correct answer is C) 4 atoms, not A) 2 atoms, B) 3 atoms, or D) 5 atoms.

questions.question_text: Noble gases exist as:
questions.explanation_correct: Noble gases exist as monoatomic atoms because they are stable on their own and do not need to form molecules to be stable. Each noble gas atom has a full outer electron shell, so they do not need to combine with other atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because noble gases do not form diatomic, triatomic, or polyatomic molecules. They are already stable as single atoms and do not need to combine with other atoms to form molecules. Only the monoatomic atoms option is correct for noble gases.

questions.question_text: What is the atomicity of sulfur in its natural form (S8)?
questions.explanation_correct: The atomicity of sulfur in its natural form (S8) is 8 because each sulfur molecule is made up of 8 atoms of sulfur bonded together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atomicity of an element refers to the number of atoms in a single molecule of that element. Since sulfur in its natural form (S8) has 8 atoms bonded together, the correct answer is option D. The other options are incorrect because 2 atoms would be diatomic, 4 atoms would be tetraatomic, and 6 atoms would be hexaatomic.

questions.question_text: A molecule of methane (CH4) contains:
questions.explanation_correct: A molecule of methane (CH4) contains a total of 5 atoms - 1 carbon atom and 4 hydrogen atoms. The chemical formula CH4 indicates that the methane molecule is made up of 1 carbon atom and 4 hydrogen atoms, for a total of 5 atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not accurately represent the number of atoms in a methane (CH4) molecule. Option A with 4 atoms is incorrect because methane has 5 atoms - 1 carbon and 4 hydrogen. Option C with 6 atoms and Option D with 8 atoms are also incorrect, as they have more atoms than a methane molecule.

questions.question_text: Chlorine gas exists as:
questions.explanation_correct: Chlorine gas exists as diatomic (Cl2) molecules, where two chlorine atoms are bonded together. This is because chlorine is a highly reactive element, and it is more stable when the atoms are joined together in pairs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chlorine gas does not exist as a monoatomic (Cl), triatomic (Cl3), or tetraatomic (Cl4) molecule. This is because chlorine atoms prefer to form stable diatomic (Cl2) molecules, where two chlorine atoms are bonded together. The other options are not the correct representation of the chlorine gas molecule.

questions.question_text: Atoms of different elements are:
questions.explanation_correct: Atoms of different elements are different from each other because each element has a unique type of atom with a different number of protons and electrons. This makes the atoms of different elements have different properties and characteristics.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Atoms of different elements are not identical to each other. They have different numbers of protons and electrons, which makes them unique. Atoms are not made of molecules - molecules are made of atoms. The size of atoms can also vary between different elements.

questions.question_text: Which statement about molecules is correct?

options.text: All molecules contain only one atom
Molecules can exist independently and show properties of the substance
Molecules are always made of different atoms

questions.explanation_correct: Option C is correct because molecules can exist independently and have the properties of the substance they are made of, like water or oxygen molecules.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because molecules can contain more than one atom. Option B is incorrect because molecules can be broken down into smaller particles like atoms. Option D is incorrect because molecules can be made of the same type of atoms, not just different atoms.

questions.question_text: An atom is the smallest particle of an element.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, an atom is the smallest particle of an element that retains its chemical properties. Atoms are the building blocks of all matter and cannot be divided further into smaller particles using chemical methods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, an atom is not the smallest particle of an element. An atom is the smallest particle of an element that retains its chemical properties, but there are even smaller particles called subatomic particles (like protons, neutrons, and electrons) that make up an atom. So an atom is not the absolute smallest particle.

questions.question_text: Atoms can be seen with the naked eye.
questions.explanation_correct: Atoms are extremely small and cannot be seen with the naked eye. Even the most powerful microscopes can only see the largest atoms, which are still too small to be visible to our eyes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Atoms are much too small to be seen with the naked eye. They are the smallest particles of an element and are measured in nanometers (one-billionth of a meter). The human eye can only see objects that are much larger than atoms, so it is not possible to see atoms without the help of very powerful microscopes.

questions.question_text: A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently' is true. Molecules are the smallest particles of a substance that can exist on their own and have the same chemical properties as the larger substance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently' is not true. An atom is actually the smallest particle of an element that can exist independently and still have the same chemical properties. Molecules are formed when atoms combine together, and they are not the smallest particles that can exist independently.

questions.question_text: Molecules are always larger than atoms.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Molecules are always larger than atoms' is false. Molecules can be smaller or larger than atoms, depending on the number of atoms they contain. A molecule may have just one atom (like hydrogen, H) or many atoms (like water, H2O).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think that molecules are always larger than atoms. However, this is not true. Molecules can be smaller than atoms in some cases. For example, the hydrogen molecule (H2) has two hydrogen atoms, which is smaller than a single helium atom. The size of a molecule depends on the number of atoms it contains, not just whether it is a molecule or an atom.

questions.question_text: A molecule of a compound contains atoms of different elements.
questions.explanation_correct: A molecule of a compound contains atoms of different elements because a compound is formed when atoms of different elements combine together. This is what makes a compound different from an element, where a molecule contains only atoms of the same type.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A molecule of an element contains only atoms of the same element, not different elements. Molecules of an element are called monoatomic (one atom) or diatomic (two atoms). Only molecules of compounds contain atoms of different elements combined together.

questions.question_text: Hydrogen gas (H2) is a diatomic molecule.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, hydrogen gas (H2) is a diatomic molecule. This means that each hydrogen molecule is made up of two hydrogen atoms bonded together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Hydrogen gas (H2) is a diatomic molecule, meaning it is made up of two hydrogen atoms bonded together. This is because hydrogen is an element, and the smallest unit of hydrogen that can exist independently is a molecule with two hydrogen atoms.

questions.question_text: Noble gases like helium and neon are diatomic.
questions.explanation_correct: Noble gases like helium and neon are actually monoatomic, meaning each atom of these gases exists independently. They do not form diatomic molecules (two atoms bonded together).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. Noble gases like helium and neon are monoatomic, not diatomic. This means they exist as individual atoms, not as molecules with two atoms bonded together. Diatomic molecules are formed by elements like hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen, but not by noble gases.

questions.question_text: Ozone (O3) is a triatomic molecule of oxygen.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the statement is true. Ozone (O3) is a molecule made up of three oxygen atoms, so it is a triatomic molecule.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Ozone (O3) is a molecule made up of three oxygen atoms. This means it is a triatomic molecule, as it has more than two atoms. The molecule has a specific structure with three oxygen atoms bonded together.

questions.question_text: H2O and O2 are both examples of molecules of elements.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is false. H2O (water) is a molecule of a compound, as it is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. O2 (oxygen gas) is a molecule of an element, as it is made up of two oxygen atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because H2O (water) is not a molecule of an element. It is a molecule of a compound, as it is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. O2 (oxygen gas) is a molecule of an element, as it is made up of two oxygen atoms.

questions.question_text: All atoms of oxygen are identical in their properties.
questions.explanation_correct: All atoms of oxygen are indeed identical in their properties. This is because all oxygen atoms have the same number of protons, electrons, and neutrons, which determine the chemical properties of an element.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'All atoms of oxygen are identical in their properties' is true. This is because oxygen is a pure element, and all its atoms have the same number of protons, electrons, and neutrons. Therefore, all oxygen atoms have the same chemical properties, regardless of their location or the substance they are a part of.

questions.question_text: An _______ is the smallest particle of an element.
questions.explanation_correct: An atom is the smallest particle of an element that retains all the chemical properties of that element. This means that atoms are the building blocks of all matter, and they cannot be broken down into smaller particles while still keeping the same chemical identity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'atom'. A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently, but it is made up of atoms. Atoms are the smallest particles of an element that have all the chemical properties of that element. So, the correct answer is 'atom', not 'molecule'.

questions.question_text: A _______ is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently.
questions.explanation_correct: A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently. This is because a molecule is made up of atoms that are chemically bonded together, forming the smallest unit of that substance that still has the same chemical properties.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'molecule' is correct because a molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist on its own. An atom is even smaller than a molecule, but an atom cannot exist independently - it needs to be combined with other atoms to form a molecule. So a molecule, not an atom, is the smallest particle that can exist by itself.

questions.question_text: Molecules are formed when atoms _______ together.
questions.explanation_correct: Molecules are formed when atoms combine together. This means that atoms join or bind together to create a new substance called a molecule. Molecules can be made of the same type of atoms (like oxygen molecules) or different types of atoms (like water molecules).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'combine'. Molecules are formed when atoms come together and bind to each other. The atoms do not just 'sit' together, but they actually 'combine' to make a new substance. Combining is the key step in forming a molecule from individual atoms.

questions.question_text: Elements with molecules containing only one atom are called _______ elements.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'monoatomic' because elements with molecules containing only one atom are called monoatomic elements. This is because 'mono' means 'single' and 'atomic' refers to the atom, so monoatomic means a single atom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be to say that the elements are called 'diatomic' or 'polyatomic'. Diatomic means the molecules contain two atoms, and polyatomic means the molecules contain more than two atoms. However, in this case, the question is asking about elements with molecules containing only one atom, which are called 'monoatomic' elements.

questions.question_text: Elements with molecules containing two atoms are called _______ elements.
questions.explanation_correct: Elements with molecules containing two atoms are called diatomic elements. This is because the prefix 'di-' means 'two', and 'atomic' refers to the number of atoms in the molecule. So diatomic elements have molecules made up of two atoms of the same element.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is diatomic elements. This is because the molecule of these elements contains two atoms of the same element. The prefix 'di-' means 'two', so diatomic refers to molecules with two atoms. The other options like monoatomic (one atom) or polyatomic (more than two atoms) do not correctly describe the number of atoms in the molecules of these elements.

questions.question_text: The number of atoms present in one molecule of an element is called its _______.
questions.explanation_correct: The number of atoms present in one molecule of an element is called its atomicity. This is because 'atomicity' refers to the number of atoms that make up a single molecule of an element.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer 'atomicity' is correct. Atomicity is the term used to describe the number of atoms present in a single molecule of an element. For example, a molecule of oxygen gas (O) has an atomicity of 2, since it is made up of two oxygen atoms. So the number of atoms in a molecule is its atomicity.

questions.question_text: Helium, neon, and argon are examples of _______ gases.
questions.explanation_correct: Helium, neon, and argon are examples of monoatomic gases because each of their atoms contains only one atom. Monoatomic means a molecule made of a single atom, and these gases have molecules with just one atom in them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is monoatomic. This means the molecules of these gases are made of only one atom each. Diatomic molecules have two atoms, and polyatomic molecules have more than two atoms. Helium, neon, and argon are all gases with monoatomic molecules.

questions.question_text: A molecule of water (H2O) contains _______ atoms of hydrogen.
questions.explanation_correct: The molecule of water (H2O) contains two atoms of hydrogen because a water molecule is made up of one oxygen atom and two hydrogen atoms. This is the chemical structure of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The molecule of water (H2O) contains two atoms of hydrogen, not one. This is because a water molecule is made up of one oxygen atom and two hydrogen atoms, so the total number of hydrogen atoms in a water molecule is two. The correct answer is 'two'.

questions.question_text: Oxygen, nitrogen, and chlorine are examples of _______ gases.
questions.explanation_correct: Oxygen, nitrogen, and chlorine are all diatomic gases, meaning that their molecules are made up of two atoms of the same element. This is because these elements are more stable when their atoms are joined together in pairs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format for this question is 'diatomic'. This is because oxygen, nitrogen, and chlorine are not monoatomic (single-atom) or polyatomic (more than two atoms) gases. Instead, their molecules are made up of two atoms of the same element, which is why they are classified as diatomic gases.

questions.question_text: Sulfur exists as S8, so its atomicity is _______.
questions.explanation_correct: The atomicity of sulfur is 8 because the sulfur molecule is made up of 8 sulfur atoms bonded together. Sulfur exists as the S8 molecule, which means each sulfur molecule has 8 atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atomicity of an element refers to the number of atoms in its molecule. Since the question states that sulfur exists as S8, the accepted answer format is a single number, which is 8. The molecule of sulfur has 8 atoms, so the atomicity of sulfur is 8.

questions.question_text: Carbon dioxide molecule contains one carbon atom and _______ oxygen atoms.
questions.explanation_correct: The carbon dioxide (CO2) molecule contains one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms. This is because a carbon dioxide molecule is formed when one carbon atom bonds with two oxygen atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The carbon dioxide (CO2) molecule contains two oxygen atoms, not just one. The correct answer is 'two'. A carbon dioxide molecule is made up of one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms, so the total number of oxygen atoms in the molecule is two.

questions.question_text: Ozone (O3) is a _______ form of oxygen with atomicity 3.
questions.explanation_correct: Ozone is a triatomic molecule, meaning it is made up of three oxygen atoms. This is because the chemical formula for ozone is O3, indicating that there are three oxygen atoms in each ozone molecule.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format for this question is 'triatomic'. This is because ozone is a form of oxygen with three oxygen atoms in each molecule, rather than one or two atoms. The number of atoms in a molecule is called the atomicity, and in the case of ozone, the atomicity is 3, making it a triatomic molecule.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following in order of increasing atomicity: He, O2, P4
questions.explanation_correct: The order of increasing atomicity is He (1 atom), O2 (2 atoms), and P4 (4 atoms). This is because the number of atoms in a molecule determines its atomicity, and the given options have increasing number of atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order is He, O2, P4 because helium (He) is a monoatomic element with 1 atom, oxygen (O2) is a diatomic element with 2 atoms, and phosphorus (P4) is a polyatomic element with 4 atoms. The number of atoms in a molecule determines its atomicity, so this order reflects the increasing number of atoms in each molecule.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following in order of increasing number of atoms per molecule: N2, S8, Ar, O3
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of the given substances in increasing number of atoms per molecule is Ar, N2, O3, S8. Argon (Ar) is a monoatomic element, meaning it has only 1 atom per molecule. Nitrogen (N2) is a diatomic element with 2 atoms per molecule. Ozone (O3) is a polyatomic molecule with 3 atoms. Sulfur (S8) is a polyatomic molecule with 8 atoms per molecule, the highest among the given options.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If you arranged the substances in the order N2, Ar, O3, S8, that would be incorrect. Nitrogen (N2) has 2 atoms per molecule, which is fewer than the 3 atoms in ozone (O3) or the 8 atoms in sulfur (S8). Argon (Ar) has only 1 atom per molecule, so it should come before N2 in the order.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following molecules in order of increasing total atoms: H2, H2O, NH3, CH4
questions.explanation_correct: The order of these molecules from least to most total atoms is: H2 (2 atoms), H2O (3 atoms), NH3 (4 atoms), and CH4 (5 atoms). This is because the number of atoms in a molecule depends on how the atoms are combined together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: H2, NH3, H2O, CH4. This is wrong because H2 has 2 atoms, H2O has 3 atoms, NH3 has 4 atoms, and CH4 has 4 atoms. The correct order is from least to most total atoms in the molecule.

questions.question_text: Arrange these element molecules from monoatomic to polyatomic: Cl2, Ne, P4
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Ne, Cl2, P4. Ne is a monoatomic element, meaning it has only one atom in its molecule. Cl2 is a diatomic element, with two chlorine atoms. P4 is a polyatomic element, with four phosphorus atoms in its molecule.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be P4, Cl2, Ne. This is wrong because P4 has more than two atoms in its molecule, so it is a polyatomic element. Cl2 has two chlorine atoms, so it is a diatomic element. Ne is a monoatomic element with only one atom in its molecule. The correct order is from monoatomic to polyatomic: Ne, Cl2, P4.

questions.question_text: Arrange from smallest to largest: atom of hydrogen, molecule of hydrogen (H2), molecule of water (H2O)
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from smallest to largest is Atom of hydrogen, Molecule of hydrogen (H2), and Molecule of water (H2O). This is because an atom of hydrogen is the smallest unit of the element, a molecule of hydrogen (H2) contains two hydrogen atoms, and a molecule of water (H2O) contains two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom, making it the largest of the three.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Molecule of water (H2O), Atom of hydrogen, Molecule of hydrogen (H2). This is wrong because a molecule of water (H2O) is larger than a single atom of hydrogen, and a molecule of hydrogen (H2) with two hydrogen atoms is larger than a single atom of hydrogen. The correct order is from smallest to largest: Atom of hydrogen, Molecule of hydrogen (H2), Molecule of water (H2O).
